Package com.crnr.hcms.assignment.controller

Class PatientApi

java.lang.Object
com.crnr.hcms.assignment.controller.PatientApi
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="*", allowedHeaders="*") @RequestMapping("/v1/api/patients") public class PatientApi extends Object

The PatientApi class represents the controller layer to accept all requests related to a patient

Version:
1.0
Author:
Namadev

  • Method Details

    • createPatient

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseDto> createPatient​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid PatientDto patientDtoRequest)
      Create a single Patient and return the created REST resource. Then return it through Spring Web's ResponseEntity fluent API.
      Parameters:
      patientDtoRequest - - the Patient to create, accepted as JSON - ID is not required, it will be ignored
      Returns:
      responseDto - created patient details

    • findById

      @GetMapping("/{patient_id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseDto> findById​(@PathVariable("patient_id") String patientId)
      Look up a single Patient and transform it into a REST resource. Then return it through Spring Web's ResponseEntity fluent API.
      Parameters:
      patientId - - the patient identifier
      Returns:
      responseDto - with single patient details

    • updatePatient

      @PutMapping("/{patient_id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseDto> updatePatient​(@PathVariable("patient_id") String patientId, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid PatientUpdateReqDto patientUpdateReqDto)
      Update a single Patient and return the updated REST resource. Then return it through Spring Web's ResponseEntity fluent API.
      Parameters:
      patientId - - the patient identifier
      patientUpdateReqDto - - the Patient to update, accepted as JSON - ID is not required, it will be ignored
      Returns:
      responseDto - with updated patient details

    • deletePatient

      @DeleteMapping("/{patient_id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseDto> deletePatient​(@PathVariable("patient_id") String patientId)
      Delete a single Patient and return the http status code OK. Then return it through Spring Web's ResponseEntity fluent API.
      Parameters:
      patientId - - the patient identifier
      Returns:
      responseDto - with status code OK

    • getPatientByFilter

      @GetMapping("/patientbyfilter") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseDto> getPatientByFilter​(@RequestParam(value="page",required=true) int page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=true) int size, @RequestParam(value="gender",required=false) String gender, @RequestParam(value="status",required=false) String status, @RequestParam(value="search",required=false) String search, @RequestParam(value="order",required=true) String order)
      Look up all Patients with filter and search, and transform them into a REST collection resource. Then return them through Spring Web's ResponseEntity fluent API.
      Parameters:
      page - - the page number
      size - - the no. of records to display in a page
      gender - - the gender is filter parameter
      status - - the status is filter parameter
      search - - the search used to search the record by name
      order - - the order of records
      Returns:
      responseDto - list of patients
